stem: A long-distance cyclist develops numbness over the medial palm and weakness in finger abduction after several days of riding. Symptoms started gradually without elbow pain. Which structure is most likely compressed?

choices.B: Median nerve in the pronator tunnel
choices.C: Radial nerve in the spiral groove
choices.E: Posterior interosseous nerve at the supinator

rationale_correct: Handlebar palsy compresses the ulnar nerve in Guyon canal, causing medial palm paresthesias and intrinsic hand weakness without elbow symptoms.

rationale_distractors.B: Pronator tunnel syndrome produces forearm pain and median territory numbness.
rationale_distractors.C: Spiral groove compression causes wrist drop and dorsum hand sensory changes, not isolated medial palm involvement.
rationale_distractors.D: Musculocutaneous nerve entrapment affects elbow flexion and lateral forearm sensation.
rationale_distractors.E: Posterior interosseous nerve lesions produce finger extension weakness without sensory loss.
